author: Vikas Vasudeva
text:
While road and rail blockades at several places were removed, protesters are still blocking over 449 road and rail points. Haryana Roadways has suffered a loss of Rs. 15 crore. “Thirty-three government buses have been set on fire and 99 damaged,” the State government said.

In Rohtak, the epicentre of the agitation, the car of a judge was set on fire, despite a curfew on the city. Protesters in Sonipat set trucks ablaze on National Highway 1. Traffic remained suspended. National Highway 10 between Hisar and Jind was blocked.

“The situation in Haryana is gradually returning to normality. However, some incidents were reported in Rohtak and Jhajjar. We are constantly monitoring the developments. Security forces have been directed to clear the blockades,” said an official of the Union Home Ministry. Train services on the Delhi-Chandigarh route have been restored.
title: Protesters still blocking roads
